title: Researchers identify mutations that can lead to resistance to some chemotherapies
snippets: Investigators have discovered that mutations to VPS35, a crucial component in a pathway that uses reactive oxygen species (ROS) to eliminate cancer cells, can lead to resistance against chemotherapies. This finding could aid in identifying tumors that are resistant to treatment.
summary: Researchers have found that mutations in VPS35, a key part of the pathway that employs reactive oxygen species (ROS) to destroy cancer cells, can cause resistance to chemotherapy treatments. This discovery may help identify tumors that are resistant to therapy.
